intro: Stigmaphyllon ruizianum var. subglabratum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a hairy calyx. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
